Input tones (separated by a space): L MH
Input tones (separated by a space): H MH
Input tones (separated by a space): MH MH

This is an unusual combination, which the speaker accepted to produce nonetheless in view of the fact that it is sometimes necessary to break open a bone to get marrow/brains (the word for both substances is the same). The phrase would then be marginally acceptable as an elliptical turn of phrase to mean 'to strike [bones] for marrow'.

Mistaken realization, without tone change: simple juxtaposition of the two words. Correct tone pattern: L.M.L, /jɤ˩jo˧ tɕɤ˩/.
